subject: Technology
title: The Human Genome Project
description: Learn The Human Genome Project in one minute.

hook.text: It took 13 years and $2.7 billion to read the complete human genetic code. Today it costs under $200 and takes a day.

buildup.text: The Human Genome Project launched in 1990 to map every gene in human DNA. Over 2,800 researchers in 20 countries collaborated.

discovery.text: Humans have about 20,000 genes, surprisingly fewer than a grape, which has about 30,000. Complexity isn't about quantity.

twist.text: A private company, Celera Genomics, raced the government project and nearly beat it. Competition accelerated the timeline.

climax.text: The completed genome became a public resource. Every researcher on Earth can access the blueprint of human biology for free.

punchline.text: Reading the human genome went from impossible to cheaper than a pair of shoes.

quiz.question: How many genes do humans have compared to grapes?
options: Humans have fewer genes than grapes
They have exactly the same number
